title: Skip Counting with Visual Patterns
description: Use visual patterns and rhythmic counting to help students learn multiplication facts through skip counting.
materials: Colored blocks, number line, rhythm instruments
steps: Start with concrete objects (blocks) arranged in equal groups
Count by the target number while pointing to each group
Add rhythm or music to make it memorable

title: Math Anxiety Breathing Technique
description: A simple breathing exercise to help students manage math anxiety before and during math tasks.

title: Fraction Pizza Method
description: Use pizza slices to make fractions concrete and relatable for students with dyscalculia.
steps: Cut colored paper into pizza slice shapes

title: Word Problem Strategy Cards
description: Step-by-step visual cards to help students break down and solve word problems systematically.
steps: Identify what the question is asking

title: Number Line Jumping
description: Physical movement combined with number line work to reinforce number sense and operations.
materials: Floor number line or tape, markers
steps: Create a large number line on the floor
Have student physically jump to numbers

title: Success Journal for Math
description: A daily practice to build math confidence by recording small wins and progress.
steps: Write one thing learned in math today

title: Hands-On Analog Clock Practice
description: Use moveable clock hands and step-by-step visual cues to teach time reading systematically.
materials: Large analog clock with moveable hands, time worksheets
steps: Start with hour hand only - practice o'clock times
Add minute hand for half-hour times

title: Digital to Analog Time Matching
description: Bridge digital and analog time formats using matching games and visual supports.
materials: Digital time cards, analog clock cards, timer
steps: Have student find matching analog clock
Use timer for time awareness activities

title: Concrete Addition & Subtraction
description: Use physical objects and visual models to make addition and subtraction concrete and understandable.
materials: Counting bears, ten frames, number line
steps: Start with concrete objects for counting
Use ten frames to show number relationships

title: Times Tables Pattern Recognition
description: Teach multiplication facts through visual patterns and skip counting rather than rote memorization.
materials: Multiplication charts, colored pencils, pattern worksheets
steps: Show visual patterns in times tables (2s, 5s, 10s)

title: Counting & Quantity Connection
description: Build number sense by connecting counting sequences to actual quantities and number symbols.
materials: Various counting objects, number cards, dot patterns
steps: Count objects while touching each one
Use dot patterns and ten frames

title: Place Value with Base-10 Blocks
description: Use manipulatives to make place value concepts concrete and visual for better understanding.
materials: Base-10 blocks, place value mats, number cards
steps: Show ones, tens, hundreds with blocks
Build numbers using place value mats
